title: Team Analysis: Black Kyurem, Zamazenta, Chien-Pao, Amoonguss, Dragonite
author: Not specified

pokemon_team.name: Calyrex-Shadow
pokemon_team.ev_explanation: Max Special Attack and Speed with the remaining EVs in Defense. The author mentions that they stopped investing in Defense because Scarf Urshifu-Rapid-Strike is no longer prevalent. They considered 204 Defense EVs to survive Banded Surging Strikes, but decided the loss in offensive power wasn't worth it.
pokemon_team.role_in_team: Primary damage dealer and sweeper. Initially used as a late-game sweeper, but with the addition of Dragonite, it can now be used as a lead to weaken opponents.

pokemon_team.name: Zamazenta
pokemon_team.ev_explanation: The EV spread is designed to survive a +2 Life Orb Psychic from Calyrex-Shadow 93.6% of the time and outspeed max speed Terapagos +2. The remaining EVs are placed in Defense. The author notes that reducing the Defense investment was a mistake and that they should have invested more in Speed to win Zamazenta mirrors. They also mention that the reduced Defense investment made it less reliable to KO Urshifu-Rapid-Strike with Body Press + Sucker Punch.
pokemon_team.role_in_team: Defensive pivot and support Pokemon. Provides Wide Guard support and deals damage with Body Press.

pokemon_team.name: Chien-Pao
pokemon_team.ev_explanation: The EV spread is designed to outspeed base 135 Speed Pokemon (Miraidon and Chien-Pao) with a Jolly nature, survive a Jolly Zacian's Play Rough when Terastallized into Water 93.6% of the time, and the rest are invested in Special Defense to survive a Modest Miraidon's Electric Tera-boosted (Life Orb) Dragon Energy. The author mentions that they reduced the Defense investment and increased Special Defense because Scarf Urshifu-Rapid-Strike is no longer prevalent.
pokemon_team.role_in_team: Offensive threat and revenge killer. Provides priority with Sucker Punch and Ice Shard.

pokemon_team.name: Amoonguss
pokemon_team.ev_explanation: The EV spread is designed to survive a Jolly Chien-Pao's Icicle Crash 93.6% of the time and a Modest Miraidon's Draco Meteor 93.6% of the time. The Speed is minimized.
pokemon_team.role_in_team: Support Pokemon. Provides redirection with Rage Powder and sleep with Spore.

pokemon_team.name: Dragonite
pokemon_team.ev_explanation: Max Attack with the remaining EVs distributed in HP, Defense, Special Defense, and Speed.
pokemon_team.role_in_team: Physical attacker and priority user. Provides strong priority with Extreme Speed.

overall_strategy: The team aims to control the pace of the battle with Amoonguss's redirection and sleep, while Calyrex-Shadow and Chien-Pao provide offensive pressure. Zamazenta provides defensive support and Dragonite offers strong priority with Extreme Speed.
translation_notes: The article discusses changes made to the team based on the metagame shift away from Scarf Urshifu-Rapid-Strike. The author also mentions the importance of Terastallizing Chien-Pao into Water in certain matchups.
content_summary: The article analyzes a VGC team featuring Calyrex-Shadow, Zamazenta, Chien-Pao, Amoonguss, and Dragonite. It details the EV spreads, move sets, and roles of each Pokemon, as well as the strategic adjustments made to the team based on the metagame.
